subject: Re: [junit] Do You Want to Skip Test Methods?
msgSnippet: ... this won t work because the test must first be extracted (i.e. start with test* ) before being executed (or if it ends with _ignored : not executed). ...
messageBody:
> Wouldnt it be better to add the "ignored" in front of the test method name,
> as "public void ignored_testMultipleSets()"?

this won't work because the test must first be extracted (i.e. start with
"test*") before being executed (or if it ends with "_ignored": not executed).

> The downside will be that the testcase might be forgotten if people stop
> use the special testrunner, since it doenst pop up in the normal
> testrunners...

Since the runner offers other non-compatible features (like sharing external
resources) there is no IMO compatibility requirement. It's a "take it or leave
it" situation and if you don't like it, don't use it.

-Vladimir

--
Vladimir R. Bossicard
